name: Ethiopian Inspired Fried Rice
description: A spicy, fusion fried rice dish utilizing the heat of Ethiopian Mitmita and the richness of butter, finished with cooling yoghurt and lemon.
keywords: Ethiopian, Fried Rice, Fusion, Spicy, Vegetarian, African Cuisine, East African, Mitmita, Spicy Rice, Butter, Caramelized Onions, Comfort Food, Gluten Free, Stir Fry, Easy Dinner, Leftover Rice Recipe, Vegetarian Main Course, Spicy Food, Yoghurt, Coriander, Garlic, Ginger, Lunch Ideas, Weeknight Dinner, Rice Bowl

recipeInstructions.name: Cook down onions
recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter in a large pan over a low heat. Add the red onion, and slowly cook down over one and a half hours until a deep brown. Don't let bits crisp up too much or it will get bitter and gross.

recipeInstructions.name: Fry rice
recipeInstructions.text: Increase the heat to medium-high and add the minced ginger and garlic and saute for a few minutes. Add the rice, sugar, mitmita and mix thoroughly. Cook for another couple of minutes to fry the rice until slightly toasted.

recipeInstructions.name: Add tomato
recipeInstructions.text: Add tomatoes and chilis and mix through. Season to taste.

recipeInstructions.name: Serve
recipeInstructions.text: Remove from heat. Serve immediately with yoghurt, a lemon juice, and fresh diced fresh coriander leaves.

notes: Mitmita is a very hot Ethiopian spice blend. Adjust the quantity based on your heat tolerance.
Day-old, cold rice works best for this recipe to prevent it from becoming mushy.
